Public Notes: Apr 2: Sam's Club is now offering COVID-19 vaccines in California.  For more info, go to https://www.samsclub.com/pharmacy/immunization?imzType=covid

(Last updated Mar 15)
**Southern California:**
- Who we’re vaccinating now — those who work in healthcare, education, childcare, agriculture, food, emergency services, residents of long-term care facilities and those age 65 or older. [See more details. ](https://healthy.kaiserpermanente.org/southern-california/health-wellness/coronavirus-information/covid-vaccine#vaccinatingnow)
- We also have begun reaching out to members between the ages of 16-64 who are at high risk of complications due to COVID-19 and are offering vaccine appointments.
- _Info for non-KP members:_ If you are in a group we are vaccinating, there is a screening process for non-members, after which you can schedule an appointment. [See more details](https://healthy.kaiserpermanente.org/southern-california/health-wellness/coronavirus-information/covid-vaccine/non-member-screen)

**Northern California:**
- Who we’re vaccinating now — people 65 and older, residents of long-term care facilities and those who work in healthcare, education and childcare, food and agriculture and emergency services.  [See more details](https://healthy.kaiserpermanente.org/northern-california/health-wellness/coronavirus-information/covid-vaccine#vaccinatingnow).
- As we get more supply, we’ll continue to include additional groups by looking at age, health risks, and job types.
- _Info for non-KP members:_ If you are in a group we are vaccinating, there is a process to register for a KP account and schedule an appointment. [See more details](https://healthy.kaiserpermanente.org/northern-california/health-wellness/coronavirus-information/covid-vaccine/vaccination-eligibility)

Mar 6: UCSF is currently vaccinating:

Provider: Blue Cross Blue Shield of CA
Public Notes: Apr 2: Blue Cross recommends that their members consult this list of vaccination clinic options: https://www.blueshieldca.com/bsca/bsc/wcm/connect/sites/sites\_content\_en/coronavirus/vaccine-locations

Apr : Currently vaccinating:
- Health care workers
- Patients who are aged 50 or older
- Individuals who are aged 18-64 with [severe health conditions](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx)
- Individuals who work or reside in high-risk congregate settings
- Persons experiencing homelessness who may move to congregate settings at short notice
- Emergency services workers
- Food or agriculture workers
- Education or childcare workers (includes staff and any other workers involved in child and/or student care)
- Public transit, airports, and commercial airlines workers

Appointments can be booked online or by phone. Details are available at https://stanfordhealthcare.org/discover/covid-19-resource-center/patient-care/safety-health-vaccine-planning.html?

Mar 30: _One Medical anticipates that it will administer vaccines to eligible members of the general public at select locations in California soon. Once available, individuals will be able to use_ _[MyTurn](http://myturn.ca.gov/) to book a vaccine appointment at a designated One Medical location or elsewhere._ Updates can be found online at https://www.onemedical.com/blog/live-well/updates-covid-19-vaccinations-efforts-your-area
